description: Continued use of property as three self-contained flats (retrospective planning permission is sought) and proposed single-storey rear extension
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Document 4, 'Residential Extensions'. | No part of the roof of the single storey rear extension hereby approved shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), and Supplementary Planning Document 4, 'Residential Extensions'. | The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the Lifetime Homes Standards and the guidance contained within SPG 7: Accessible Ealing or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to the occupation of the residential units hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter.   Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: Accessible Ealing. | Details of noise levels, the noise exposure category and noise mitigation measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development. Any noise mitigation measures shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the initial occupation of any of the residential flats and thereafter permanently maintained.  Reason: To maintain and protect the residential amenities of the occupiers of the flats, in accordance with policies 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 - Noise and Vibration. | Details of refuse storage (including provisions for recycling) and a management plan (including an annual review or as requested) in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be installed and implemented prior to the first occupation of the redevelopment permitted and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To safeguard the living and working conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interest of the environment, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment', 2004.
